newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Single currency tops French agenda of Portugal PM.
newsitem.headline: Single currency tops French agenda of Portugal PM.

text.p: Portugal's Prime Minister Antonio Guterres makes his first official visit to France on Sunday with the European Union's plans for a single currency at the top of the agenda.

The Socialist leader, who will have talks with President Jacques Chirac and Prime Minister Alain Juppe during his three-day stay, has made qualifying for economic and monetary union (EMU) in 1999 his government's top policy priority.
His visit coincides with a fresh wave of doubt on financial markets that the so-called Club Med countries -- Italy, Spain and Portugal -- will be allowed to join EMU at its launch.
Proposals to revise the Maastricht Treaty, the European Union's political charter, will also be discussed during Guterres' visit, official sources said.
